column4: New release coming out this month..  Is there a changelog available?
dapper has been delayed ...
squid
squid the standard?
i would say so ... and it's in main
does 'df' show it as mounted? if so, is /media/cdrom the mountpoint?
You can use evolution to read the mail, or install "mailx" to get the classic CLI mail client.  You shouldn't need anything else (after postfix) to send mail
so postfix recieves mail from the internet and also sends mail out to the internet?
yes, that's my experience.
ok.. i'll see if i have this figured out then..
so for people to email me the only port i need to open would be 25 correct?  what would 110 be for?

(sorry got called away) yes that's right.  Installing postfix opens port 25 (it might only be open to localhost I'm not sure) port 110 is pop3 which is used if you run a mailserver (dovecot for example) to allow people to collect mail remotely
so if nobody needs to collect it remotely then i'm good..  for example if i use squirrelmail i wouldn't need that
also..  my postfix file says mynetworks = 127.0.0.0/8, does that mean i will not get mail from outside?

if i've got it right, that means that only local users can use postfix to send mail (so you won't be a spam gateway).  receiving is another issue.  do a 'sudo netstat -plunt' and see if it is listening on 0.0.0.0:25
I'm fairly sure that by default, postfix is set up to receive mail from outside, but it will only accept it for local users
it is listening..
how can i make sure it will only accept mail for local users?  the main.cf file doesn't have man options by default
sorry, that i'm really not sure about.  Either someone else here knows postfix config better than I or it's to the Doco for you :)
Doco for me lol.. thanks bud.. you have helped out a lot
cool :)
